name: Red Hot Chipotle Bacon Mac and Cheese
description: A next-level macaroni and cheese with a red sauce, smoky chipotle spice, and bacon.
recipeIngredient: 1 ½ cups Barilla® Roasted Garlic Sauce
1 canned chipotle chile in adobo, or more to taste
1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2 1/2- or 3-quart baking dish.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 minutes. Drain. Return pasta to pot; cover. Keep warm off heat.
Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned and crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Crumble.
Puree milk, heavy cream, cumin, salt, pepper, and chipotle pepper in a blender or food processor. Pulse until the pepper is completely incorporated into the mixture, 8 to 10 pulses.

Place butter and minced garlic in a saucepan over medium-high heat; stir until butter is melted. Whisk flour into butter mixture, and continue whisking until flour starts to turn golden brown, about 1 minute. Slowly add pureed milk and chipotle mixture to the saucepan, whisking until there are no more lumps. Bring to a boil, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to medium.

Stir Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheeses into the cream mixture, stirring until the cheese is melted.  Add roasted garlic sauce and mix thoroughly. Transfer mixture to pot with cooked pasta; stir. Pour into prepared baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven until bubbly, about 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven. Stir in crumbled bacon and chopped bell pepper. Bake until lightly browned, about 10 more minutes. Garnish with chopped parsley.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Red Hot Chipotle Bacon Mac and Cheese

review.reviewBody: We made a couple of changes. We used fresh roasted peppers rotini pasta and left out the bacon. It was really good with the fresh peppers. My husband loved it and we will definitely be making it again. I only gave it four stars because it uses heavy cream and in the future I would figure out a good alternative to the heavy cream. Otherwise it was very tasty.

I made this for visiting family and everyone really enjoyed the flavor but the feedback from everyone was that the texture of the sauce wasn't quite right. I think next time I'd leave out the flour portion and add a little velveeta for that classic thick and creamy Mac and cheese texture. I used two chipotle peppers and the flavor was spot on!
Easy dish to make during the week and also to freeze which comes in handy for us when we get busy. Can't go wrong with bacon cheese and chipotle. Will make again!

This is as good as it sounds delivering a deliciously spicy and creamy mac n cheese. The bacon and the chipotle pepper are a beautiful couple. The bell pepper is a very nice addition. Thank you for the recipe.
